text: Now King David was old and advanced in years. And although they covered him with clothes, he could not get warm.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore his servants said to him, “Let a young woman be sought for my lord the king, and let her wait on the king and be in his service. Let her lie in your arms, that my lord the king may be warm.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they sought for a beautiful young woman throughout all the territory of Israel, and found Abishag the Shunammite, and brought her to the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: The young woman was very beautiful, and she was of service to the king and attended to him, but the king knew her not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Adonijah the son of Haggith exalted himself, saying, “I will be king.” And he prepared for himself chariots and horsemen, and fifty men to run before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: His father had never at any time displeased him by asking, “Why have you done thus and so?” He was also a very handsome man, and he was born next after Absalom.
speaker: Narrator

text: He conferred with Joab the son of Zeruiah and with Abiathar the priest. And they followed Adonijah and helped him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Zadok the priest and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada and Nathan the prophet and Shimei and Rei and David's mighty men were not with Adonijah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Adonijah sacrificed sheep, oxen, and fattened cattle by the Serpent's Stone, which is beside En-rogel, and he invited all his brothers, the king's sons, and all the royal officials of Judah,
speaker: Narrator

text: but he did not invite Nathan the prophet or Benaiah or the mighty men or Solomon his brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Nathan said to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon, “Have you not heard that Adonijah the son of Haggith has become king and David our lord does not know it?
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore come, let me give you advice, that you may save your own life and the life of your son Solomon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go in at once to King David, and say to him, ‘Did you not, my lord the king, swear to your servant, saying, “Solomon your son shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne”? Why then is Adonijah king?’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then while you are still speaking with the king, I also will come in after you and confirm your words.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Bathsheba went to the king in his chamber (now the king was very old, and Abishag the Shunammite was attending to the king).
speaker: Narrator

text: Bathsheba bowed and paid homage to the king, and the king said, “What do you desire?”
speaker: Narrator

text: She said to him, “My lord, you swore to your servant by the Lord your God, saying, ‘Solomon your son shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, behold, Adonijah is king, although you, my lord the king, do not know it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has sacrificed oxen, fattened cattle, and sheep in abundance, and has invited all the sons of the king, Abiathar the priest, and Joab the commander of the army, but Solomon your servant he has not invited.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, my lord the king, the eyes of all Israel are on you, to tell them who shall sit on the throne of my lord the king after him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Otherwise it will come to pass, when my lord the king sleeps with his fathers, that I and my son Solomon will be counted offenders.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While she was still speaking with the king, Nathan the prophet came in.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they told the king, “Here is Nathan the prophet.” And when he came in before the king, he bowed before the king, with his face to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Nathan said, “My lord the king, have you said, ‘Adonijah shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne’?
speaker: Narrator

text: For he has gone down this day and has sacrificed oxen, fattened cattle, and sheep in abundance, and has invited all the king's sons, the commanders of the army, and Abiathar the priest. And behold, they are eating and drinking before him, and saying, ‘Long live King Adonijah!’
speaker: Narrator

text: But me, your servant, and Zadok the priest, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and your servant Solomon he has not invited.
speaker: Narrator

text: Has this thing been brought about by my lord the king and you have not told your servants who should sit on the throne of my lord the king after him?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then King David answered, “Call Bathsheba to me.” So she came into the king's presence and stood before the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king swore, saying, “As the Lord lives, who has redeemed my soul out of every adversity,
speaker: Narrator

text: as I swore to you by the Lord, the God of Israel, saying, ‘Solomon your son shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne in my place’, even so will I do this day.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Bathsheba bowed with her face to the ground and paid homage to the king and said, “May my lord King David live for ever!”
speaker: Narrator

text: King David said, “Call to me Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada.” So they came before the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king said to them, “Take with you the servants of your lord and have Solomon my son ride on my own mule, and bring him down to Gihon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet there anoint him king over Israel. Then blow the trumpet and say, ‘Long live King Solomon!’
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall then come up after him, and he shall come and sit on my throne, for he shall be king in my place. And I have appointed him to be ruler over Israel and over Judah.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada answered the king, “Amen! May the Lord, the God of my lord the king, say so.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the Lord has been with my lord the king, even so may he be with Solomon, and make his throne greater than the throne of my lord King David.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites went down and made Solomon ride on King David's mule and brought him to Gihon.
speaker: Narrator

text: There Zadok the priest took the horn of oil from the tent and anointed Solomon. Then they blew the trumpet, and all the people said, “Long live King Solomon!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the people went up after him, playing on pipes, and rejoicing with great joy, so that the earth was split by their noise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Adonijah and all the guests who were with him heard it as they finished feasting. And when Joab heard the sound of the trumpet, he said, “What does this uproar in the city mean?”
speaker: Narrator

text: While he was still speaking, behold, Jonathan the son of Abiathar the priest came. And Adonijah said, “Come in, for you are a worthy man and bring good news.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jonathan answered Adonijah, “No, for our lord King David has made Solomon king,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the king has sent with him Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites. And they made him ride on the king's mule.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Zadok the priest and Nathan the prophet have anointed him king at Gihon, and they have gone up from there rejoicing, so that the city is in an uproar. This is the noise that you have heard.
speaker: Narrator

text: Solomon sits on the royal throne.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, the king's servants came to congratulate our lord King David, saying, ‘May your God make the name of Solomon more famous than yours, and make his throne greater than your throne.’ And the king bowed himself on the bed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king also said, ‘Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, who has granted someone to sit on my throne this day, my own eyes seeing it.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the guests of Adonijah trembled and rose, and each went his own way.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Adonijah feared Solomon. So he arose and went and took hold of the horns of the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it was told Solomon, “Behold, Adonijah fears King Solomon, for behold, he has laid hold of the horns of the altar, saying, ‘Let King Solomon swear to me first that he will not put his servant to death with the sword.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon said, “If he will show himself a worthy man, not one of his hairs shall fall to the earth, but if wickedness is found in him, he shall die.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So King Solomon sent, and they brought him down from the altar. And he came and paid homage to King Solomon, and Solomon said to him, “Go to your house.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When David's time to die drew near, he commanded Solomon his son, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “I am about to go the way of all the earth. Be strong, and show yourself a man,
speaker: Narrator

text: and keep the charge of the Lord your God, walking in his ways and keeping his statutes, his commandments, his rules, and his testimonies, as it is written in the Law of Moses, that you may prosper in all that you do and wherever you turn,
speaker: Narrator

text: that the Lord may establish his word that he spoke concerning me, saying, ‘If your sons pay close attention to their way, to walk before me in faithfulness with all their heart and with all their soul, you shall not lack a man on the throne of Israel.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Moreover, you also know what Joab the son of Zeruiah did to me, how he dealt with the two commanders of the armies of Israel, Abner the son of Ner, and Amasa the son of Jether, whom he killed, avenging in time of peace for blood that had been shed in war, and putting the blood of war on the belt round his waist and on the sandals on his feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Act therefore according to your wisdom, but do not let his grey head go down to Sheol in peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: But deal loyally with the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite, and let them be among those who eat at your table, for with such loyalty they met me when I fled from Absalom your brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there is also with you Shimei the son of Gera, the Benjaminite from Bahurim, who cursed me with a grievous curse on the day when I went to Mahanaim. But when he came down to meet me at the Jordan, I swore to him by the Lord, saying, ‘I will not put you to death with the sword.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore do not hold him guiltless, for you are a wise man. You will know what you ought to do to him, and you shall bring his grey head down with blood to Sheol.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then David slept with his fathers and was buried in the city of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the time that David reigned over Israel was forty years. He reigned for seven years in Hebron and for thirty-three years in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Solomon sat on the throne of David his father, and his kingdom was firmly established.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Adonijah the son of Haggith came to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon. And she said, “Do you come peacefully?” He said, “Peacefully.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, “I have something to say to you.” She said, “Speak.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “You know that the kingdom was mine, and that all Israel fully expected me to reign. However, the kingdom has turned about and become my brother's, for it was his from the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now I have one request to make of you; do not refuse me.” She said to him, “Speak.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “Please ask King Solomon—he will not refuse you—to give me Abishag the Shunammite as my wife.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Bathsheba said, “Very well; I will speak for you to the king.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Bathsheba went to King Solomon to speak to him on behalf of Adonijah. And the king rose to meet her and bowed down to her. Then he sat on his throne and had a seat brought for the king's mother, and she sat on his right.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then she said, “I have one small request to make of you; do not refuse me.” And the king said to her, “Make your request, my mother, for I will not refuse you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: She said, “Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to Adonijah your brother as his wife.”
speaker: Narrator

text: King Solomon answered his mother, “And why do you ask Abishag the Shunammite for Adonijah? Ask for him the kingdom also, for he is my older brother, and on his side are Abiathar the priest and Joab the son of Zeruiah.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then King Solomon swore by the Lord, saying, “God do so to me and more also if this word does not cost Adonijah his life!
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore as the Lord lives, who has established me and placed me on the throne of David my father, and who has made me a house, as he promised, Adonijah shall be put to death today.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So King Solomon sent Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and he struck him down, and he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: And to Abiathar the priest the king said, “Go to Anathoth, to your estate, for you deserve death. But I will not at this time put you to death, because you carried the ark of the Lord God before David my father, and because you shared in all my father's affliction.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Solomon expelled Abiathar from being priest to the Lord, thus fulfilling the word of the Lord that he had spoken concerning the house of Eli in Shiloh.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the news came to Joab—for Joab had supported Adonijah although he had not supported Absalom—Joab fled to the tent of the Lord and caught hold of the horns of the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when it was told King Solomon, “Joab has fled to the tent of the Lord, and behold, he is beside the altar,” Solomon sent Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, saying, “Go, strike him down.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Benaiah came to the tent of the Lord and said to him, “The king commands, ‘Come out.’” But he said, “No, I will die here.” Then Benaiah brought the king word again, saying, “Thus said Joab, and thus he answered me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The king replied to him, “Do as he has said, strike him down and bury him, and thus take away from me and from my father's house the guilt for the blood that Joab shed without cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will bring back his bloody deeds on his own head, because, without the knowledge of my father David, he attacked and killed with the sword two men more righteous and better than himself, Abner the son of Ner, commander of the army of Israel, and Amasa the son of Jether, commander of the army of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: So shall their blood come back on the head of Joab and on the head of his descendants for ever. But for David and for his descendants and for his house and for his throne there shall be peace from the Lord for evermore.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Benaiah the son of Jehoiada went up and struck him down and put him to death. And he was buried in his own house in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: The king put Benaiah the son of Jehoiada over the army in place of Joab, and the king put Zadok the priest in the place of Abiathar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the king sent and summoned Shimei and said to him, “Build yourself a house in Jerusalem and dwell there, and do not go out from there to any place whatever.
speaker: Narrator

text: For on the day you go out and cross the brook Kidron, know for certain that you shall die. Your blood shall be on your own head.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Shimei said to the king, “What you say is good; as my lord the king has said, so will your servant do.” So Shimei lived in Jerusalem for many days.
speaker: Narrator

text: But it happened at the end of three years that two of Shimei's servants ran away to Achish, son of Maacah, king of Gath. And when it was told Shimei, “Behold, your servants are in Gath”,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shimei arose and saddled a donkey and went to Gath to Achish to seek his servants. Shimei went and brought his servants from Gath.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Solomon was told that Shimei had gone from Jerusalem to Gath and returned,
speaker: Narrator

text: the king sent and summoned Shimei and said to him, “Did I not make you swear by the Lord and solemnly warn you, saying, ‘Know for certain that on the day you go out and go to any place whatever, you shall die’? And you said to me, ‘What you say is good; I will obey.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Why then have you not kept your oath to the Lord and the commandment with which I commanded you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The king also said to Shimei, “You know in your own heart all the harm that you did to David my father. So the Lord will bring back your harm on your own head.
speaker: Narrator

text: But King Solomon shall be blessed, and the throne of David shall be established before the Lord for ever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Solomon made a marriage alliance with Pharaoh king of Egypt. He took Pharaoh's daughter and brought her into the city of David until he had finished building his own house and the house of the Lord and the wall round Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people were sacrificing at the high places, however, because no house had yet been built for the name of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Solomon loved the Lord, walking in the statutes of David his father, only he sacrificed and made offerings at the high places.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king went to Gibeon to sacrifice there, for that was the great high place. Solomon used to offer a thousand burnt offerings on that altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: At Gibeon the Lord appeared to Solomon in a dream by night, and God said, “Ask what I shall give you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon said, “You have shown great and steadfast love to your servant David my father, because he walked before you in faithfulness, in righteousness, and in uprightness of heart towards you. And you have kept for him this great and steadfast love and have given him a son to sit on his throne this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, O Lord my God, you have made your servant king in place of David my father, although I am but a little child. I do not know how to go out or come in.
speaker: Narrator

text: And your servant is in the midst of your people whom you have chosen, a great people, too many to be numbered or counted for multitude.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give your servant therefore an understanding mind to govern your people, that I may discern between good and evil, for who is able to govern this your great people?”
speaker: Narrator

text: It pleased the Lord that Solomon had asked this.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God said to him, “Because you have asked this, and have not asked for yourself long life or riches or the life of your enemies, but have asked for yourself understanding to discern what is right,
speaker: Narrator

text: behold, I now do according to your word. Behold, I give you a wise and discerning mind, so that none like you has been before you and none like you shall arise after you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I give you also what you have not asked, both riches and honour, so that no other king shall compare with you, all your days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if you will walk in my ways, keeping my statutes and my commandments, as your father David walked, then I will lengthen your days.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon awoke, and behold, it was a dream. Then he came to Jerusalem and stood before the ark of the covenant of the Lord, and offered up burnt offerings and peace offerings, and made a feast for all his servants.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then two prostitutes came to the king and stood before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one woman said, “Oh, my lord, this woman and I live in the same house, and I gave birth to a child while she was in the house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then on the third day after I gave birth, this woman also gave birth. And we were alone. There was no one else with us in the house; only we two were in the house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this woman's son died in the night, because she lay on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she arose at midnight and took my son from beside me, while your servant slept, and laid him at her breast, and laid her dead son at my breast.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I rose in the morning to nurse my child, behold, he was dead. But when I looked at him closely in the morning, behold, he was not the child that I had borne.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the other woman said, “No, the living child is mine, and the dead child is yours.” The first said, “No, the dead child is yours, and the living child is mine.” Thus they spoke before the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the king said, “One says, ‘This is my son that is alive, and your son is dead’; and the other says, ‘No; but your son is dead, and my son is the living one.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king said, “Bring me a sword.” So a sword was brought before the king.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king said, “Divide the living child in two, and give half to one and half to the other.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the woman whose son was alive said to the king, because her heart yearned for her son, “Oh, my lord, give her the living child, and by no means put him to death.” But the other said, “He shall be neither mine nor yours; divide him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the king answered and said, “Give the living child to the first woman, and by no means put him to death; she is his mother.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And all Israel heard of the judgement that the king had rendered, and they stood in awe of the king, because they perceived that the wisdom of God was in him to do justice.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: Ben-deker, in Makaz, Shaalbim, Beth-shemesh, and Elonbeth-hanan;
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: Ahinadab the son of Iddo, in Mahanaim;
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: Judah and Israel were as many as the sand by the sea. They ate and drank and were happy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Solomon ruled over all the kingdoms from the Euphrates to the land of the Philistines and to the border of Egypt. They brought tribute and served Solomon all the days of his life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Solomon's provision for one day was thirty cors of fine flour and sixty cors of meal,
speaker: Narrator

text: ten fat oxen, and twenty pasture-fed cattle, a hundred sheep, besides deer, gazelles, roebucks, and fattened fowl.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he had dominion over all the region west of the Euphrates from Tiphsah to Gaza, over all the kings west of the Euphrates. And he had peace on all sides around him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Judah and Israel lived in safety, from Dan even to Beersheba, every man under his vine and under his fig tree, all the days of Solomon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Solomon also had 40,000 stalls of horses for his chariots, and 12,000 horsemen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those officers supplied provisions for King Solomon, and for all who came to King Solomon's table, each one in his month. They let nothing be lacking.
speaker: Narrator

text: Barley also and straw for the horses and swift steeds they brought to the place where it was required, each according to his duty.
speaker: Narrator

text: And God gave Solomon wisdom and understanding beyond measure, and breadth of mind like the sand on the seashore,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that Solomon's wisdom surpassed the wisdom of all the people of the east and all the wisdom of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he was wiser than all other men, wiser than Ethan the Ezrahite, and Heman, Calcol, and Darda, the sons of Mahol, and his fame was in all the surrounding nations.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also spoke 3,000 proverbs, and his songs were 1,005.
speaker: Narrator

text: He spoke of trees, from the cedar that is in Lebanon to the hyssop that grows out of the wall. He spoke also of beasts, and of birds, and of reptiles, and of fish.
speaker: Narrator

text: And people of all nations came to hear the wisdom of Solomon, and from all the kings of the earth, who had heard of his wisdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Hiram king of Tyre sent his servants to Solomon when he heard that they had anointed him king in place of his father, for Hiram always loved David.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon sent word to Hiram,
speaker: Narrator

text: “You know that David my father could not build a house for the name of the Lord his God because of the warfare with which his enemies surrounded him, until the Lord put them under the soles of his feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now the Lord my God has given me rest on every side. There is neither adversary nor misfortune.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so I intend to build a house for the name of the Lord my God, as the Lord said to David my father, ‘Your son, whom I will set on your throne in your place, shall build the house for my name.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore command that cedars of Lebanon be cut for me. And my servants will join your servants, and I will pay you for your servants such wages as you set, for you know that there is no one among us who knows how to cut timber like the Sidonians.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As soon as Hiram heard the words of Solomon, he rejoiced greatly and said, “Blessed be the Lord this day, who has given to David a wise son to be over this great people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Hiram sent to Solomon, saying, “I have heard the message that you have sent to me. I am ready to do all you desire in the matter of cedar and cypress timber.
speaker: Narrator

text: My servants shall bring it down to the sea from Lebanon, and I will make it into rafts to go by sea to the place you direct. And I will have them broken up there, and you shall receive it. And you shall meet my wishes by providing food for my household.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Hiram supplied Solomon with all the timber of cedar and cypress that he desired,
speaker: Narrator

text: The house that King Solomon built for the Lord was sixty cubits long, twenty cubits wide, and thirty cubits high.

speaker: Narrator

text: And he made for the house windows with recessed frames.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also built a structure against the wall of the house, running round the walls of the house, both the nave and the inner sanctuary. And he made side chambers all round.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: So he built the house and finished it, and he made the ceiling of the house of beams and planks of cedar.
speaker: Narrator

text: He built the structure against the whole house, five cubits high, and it was joined to the house with timbers of cedar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the word of the Lord came to Solomon,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Concerning this house that you are building, if you will walk in my statutes and obey my rules and keep all my commandments and walk in them, then I will establish my word with you, which I spoke to David your father.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: So Solomon built the house and finished it.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: He built twenty cubits of the rear of the house with boards of cedar from the floor to the walls, and he built this within as an inner sanctuary, as the Most Holy Place.

speaker: Narrator

text: The cedar within the house was carved in the form of gourds and open flowers. All was cedar; no stone was seen.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: And Solomon overlaid the inside of the house with pure gold, and he drew chains of gold across, in front of the inner sanctuary, and overlaid it with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he overlaid the whole house with gold, until all the house was finished. Also the whole altar that belonged to the inner sanctuary he overlaid with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the inner sanctuary he made two cherubim of olive wood, each ten cubits high.
speaker: Narrator

text: Five cubits was the length of one wing of the cherub, and five cubits the length of the other wing of the cherub; it was ten cubits from the tip of one wing to the tip of the other.
speaker: Narrator

text: The other cherub also measured ten cubits; both cherubim had the same measure and the same form.
speaker: Narrator

text: The height of one cherub was ten cubits, and so was that of the other cherub.
speaker: Narrator

text: He put the cherubim in the innermost part of the house. And the wings of the cherubim were spread out so that a wing of one touched one wall, and a wing of the other cherub touched the other wall; their other wings touched each other in the middle of the house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he overlaid the cherubim with gold.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: The floor of the house he overlaid with gold in the inner and outer rooms.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: He covered the two doors of olive wood with carvings of cherubim, palm trees, and open flowers. He overlaid them with gold and spread gold on the cherubim and on the palm trees.
speaker: Narrator

text: So also he made for the entrance to the nave doorposts of olive wood, in the form of a square,
speaker: Narrator

text: and two doors of cypress wood. The two leaves of one door were folding, and the two leaves of the other door were folding.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: His own house where he was to dwell, in the other court back of the hall, was of like workmanship. Solomon also made a house like this hall for Pharaoh's daughter whom he had taken in marriage.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: The foundation was of costly stones, huge stones, stones of eight and ten cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: And above were costly stones, cut according to measurement, and cedar.
speaker: Narrator

text: The great court had three courses of cut stone all round, and a course of cedar beams; so had the inner court of the house of the Lord and the vestibule of the house.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: Under its brim were gourds, for ten cubits, compassing the sea all round. The gourds were in two rows, cast with it when it was cast.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: Its thickness was a handbreadth, and its brim was made like the brim of a cup, like the flower of a lily. It held two thousand baths.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made the ten stands of bronze. Each stand was four cubits long, four cubits wide, and three cubits high.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was the construction of the stands: they had panels, and the panels were set in the frames,
speaker: Narrator

text: and on the panels that were set in the frames were lions, oxen, and cherubim. On the frames, both above and below the lions and oxen, there were wreaths of bevelled work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, each stand had four bronze wheels and axles of bronze, and at the four corners were supports for a basin. The supports were cast with wreaths at the side of each.
speaker: Narrator

text: Its opening was within a crown that projected upwards one cubit. Its opening was round, as a pedestal is made, a cubit and a half deep. At its opening there were carvings, and its panels were square, not round.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the four wheels were underneath the panels. The axles of the wheels were of one piece with the stands, and the height of a wheel was a cubit and a half.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: There were four supports at the four corners of each stand. The supports were of one piece with the stands.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the top of the stand there was a round band half a cubit high; and on the top of the stand its stays and its panels were of one piece with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the surfaces of its stays and on its panels, he carved cherubim, lions, and palm trees, according to the space of each, with wreaths all round.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this manner he made the ten stands. All of them were cast alike, of the same measure and the same form.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made ten basins of bronze. Each basin held forty baths, each basin measured four cubits, and there was a basin for each of the ten stands.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he set the stands, five on the south side of the house, and five on the north side of the house. And he set the sea at the southeast corner of the house.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: the ten stands, and the ten basins on the stands;
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: Now it was in the heart of David my father to build a house for the name of the Lord, the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: And there I have provided a place for the ark, in which is the covenant of the Lord that he made with our fathers, when he brought them out of the land of Egypt.”
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “O Lord, God of Israel, there is no God like you, in heaven above or on earth beneath, keeping covenant and showing steadfast love to your servants who walk before you with all their heart,
speaker: Narrator

text: who have kept with your servant David my father what you declared to him. You spoke with your mouth, and with your hand have fulfilled it this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, O Lord, God of Israel, keep for your servant David my father what you have promised him, saying, ‘You shall not lack a man to sit before me on the throne of Israel, if only your sons pay close attention to their way, to walk before me as you have walked before me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, O God of Israel, let your word be confirmed, which you have spoken to your servant David my father.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But will God indeed dwell on the earth? Behold, heaven and the highest heaven cannot contain you; how much less this house that I have built!
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet have regard to the prayer of your servant and to his plea, O Lord my God, listening to the cry and to the prayer that your servant prays before you this day,
speaker: Narrator

text: that your eyes may be open night and day towards this house, the place of which you have said, ‘My name shall be there’, that you may listen to the prayer that your servant offers towards this place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And listen to the plea of your servant and of your people Israel, when they pray towards this place. And listen in heaven your dwelling place, and when you hear, forgive.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If a man sins against his neighbour and is made to take an oath and comes and swears his oath before your altar in this house,
speaker: Narrator

text: then hear in heaven and act and judge your servants, condemning the guilty by bringing his conduct on his own head, and vindicating the righteous by rewarding him according to his righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When your people Israel are defeated before the enemy because they have sinned against you, and if they turn again to you and acknowledge your name and pray and plead with you in this house,
speaker: Narrator

text: then hear in heaven and forgive the sin of your people Israel and bring them again to the land that you gave to their fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When heaven is shut up and there is no rain because they have sinned against you, if they pray towards this place and acknowledge your name and turn from their sin, when you afflict them,
speaker: Narrator

text: then hear in heaven and forgive the sin of your servants, your people Israel, when you teach them the good way in which they should walk, and grant rain upon your land, which you have given to your people as an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If there is famine in the land, if there is pestilence or blight or mildew or locust or caterpillar, if their enemy besieges them in the land at their gates, whatever plague, whatever sickness there is,
speaker: Narrator

text: whatever prayer, whatever plea is made by any man or by all your people Israel, each knowing the affliction of his own heart and stretching out his hands towards this house,
speaker: Narrator

text: then hear in heaven your dwelling place and forgive and act and render to each whose heart you know, according to all his ways (for you, you only, know the hearts of all the children of mankind),
speaker: Narrator

text: that they may fear you all the days that they live in the land that you gave to our fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Likewise, when a foreigner, who is not of your people Israel, comes from a far country for your name's sake
speaker: Narrator

text: (for they shall hear of your great name and your mighty hand, and of your outstretched arm), when he comes and prays towards this house,
speaker: Narrator

text: hear in heaven your dwelling place and do according to all for which the foreigner calls to you, in order that all the peoples of the earth may know your name and fear you, as do your people Israel, and that they may know that this house that I have built is called by your name.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If your people go out to battle against their enemy, by whatever way you shall send them, and they pray to the Lord towards the city that you have chosen and the house that I have built for your name,
speaker: Narrator

text: then hear in heaven their prayer and their plea, and maintain their cause.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If they sin against you—for there is no one who does not sin—and you are angry with them and give them to an enemy, so that they are carried away captive to the land of the enemy, far off or near,
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: then hear in heaven your dwelling place their prayer and their plea, and maintain their cause
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: For you separated them from among all the peoples of the earth to be your heritage, as you declared through Moses your servant, when you brought our fathers out of Egypt, O Lord God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now as Solomon finished offering all this prayer and plea to the Lord, he arose from before the altar of the Lord, where he had knelt with hands outstretched towards heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he stood and blessed all the assembly of Israel with a loud voice, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Blessed be the Lord who has given rest to his people Israel, according to all that he promised. Not one word has failed of all his good promise, which he spoke by Moses his servant.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord our God be with us, as he was with our fathers. May he not leave us or forsake us,
speaker: Narrator

text: that he may incline our hearts to him, to walk in all his ways and to keep his commandments, his statutes, and his rules, which he commanded our fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let these words of mine, with which I have pleaded before the Lord, be near to the Lord our God day and night, and may he maintain the cause of his servant and the cause of his people Israel, as each day requires,
speaker: Narrator

text: that all the peoples of the earth may know that the Lord is God; there is no other.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let your heart therefore be wholly true to the Lord our God, walking in his statutes and keeping his commandments, as at this day.”
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: Solomon offered as peace offerings to the Lord 22,000 oxen and 120,000 sheep. So the king and all the people of Israel dedicated the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: The same day the king consecrated the middle of the court that was before the house of the Lord, for there he offered the burnt offering and the grain offering and the fat pieces of the peace offerings, because the bronze altar that was before the Lord was too small to receive the burnt offering and the grain offering and the fat pieces of the peace offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Solomon held the feast at that time, and all Israel with him, a great assembly, from Lebo-hamath to the Brook of Egypt, before the Lord our God, seven days.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the eighth day he sent the people away, and they blessed the king and went to their homes joyful and glad of heart for all the goodness that the Lord had shown to David his servant and to Israel his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: As soon as Solomon had finished building the house of the Lord and the king's house and all that Solomon desired to build,
speaker: Narrator

text: the Lord appeared to Solomon a second time, as he had appeared to him at Gibeon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said to him, “I have heard your prayer and your plea, which you have made before me. I have consecrated this house that you have built, by putting my name there for ever. My eyes and my heart will be there for all time.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as for you, if you will walk before me, as David your father walked, with integrity of heart and uprightness, doing according to all that I have commanded you, and keeping my statutes and my rules,
speaker: Narrator

text: then I will establish your royal throne over Israel for ever, as I promised David your father, saying, ‘You shall not lack a man on the throne of Israel.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you turn aside from following me, you or your children, and do not keep my commandments and my statutes that I have set before you, but go and serve other gods and worship them,
speaker: Narrator

text: then I will cut off Israel from the land that I have given them, and the house that I have consecrated for my name I will cast out of my sight, and Israel will become a proverb and a byword among all peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this house will become a heap of ruins. Everyone passing by it will be astonished and will hiss, and they will say, ‘Why has the Lord done thus to this land and to this house?’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they will say, ‘Because they abandoned the Lord their God who brought their fathers out of the land of Egypt and laid hold on other gods and worshipped them and served them. Therefore the Lord has brought all this disaster on them.’”
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jeroboam's wife arose and departed and came to Tirzah. And as she came to the threshold of the house, the child died.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all Israel buried him and mourned for him, according to the word of the Lord, which he spoke by his servant Ahijah the prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, how he warred and how he reigned, behold, they are written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the time that Jeroboam reigned was twenty-two years. And he slept with his fathers, and Nadab his son reigned in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Rehoboam the son of Solomon reigned in Judah. Rehoboam was forty-one years old when he began to reign, and he reigned for seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city that the Lord had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, to put his name there. His mother's name was Naamah the Ammonite.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Judah did what was evil in the sight of the Lord, and they provoked him to jealousy with their sins that they committed, more than all that their fathers had done.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they also built for themselves high places and pillars and Asherim on every high hill and under every green tree,
speaker: Narrator

text: and there were also male cult prostitutes in the land. They did according to all the abominations of the nations that the Lord drove out before the people of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the fifth year of King Rehoboam, Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: He took away the treasures of the house of the Lord and the treasures of the king's house. He took away everything. He also took away all the shields of gold that Solomon had made,
speaker: Narrator

text: and King Rehoboam made in their place shields of bronze, and committed them to the hands of the officers of the guard, who kept the door of the king's house.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as often as the king went into the house of the Lord, the guard carried them and brought them back to the guardroom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the rest of the acts of Rehoboam and all that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah?
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Rehoboam slept with his fathers and was buried with his fathers in the city of David. His mother's name was Naamah the Ammonite. And Abijam his son reigned in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in the eighteenth year of King Jeroboam the son of Nebat, Abijam began to reign over Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: He reigned for three years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Maacah the daughter of Abishalom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he walked in all the sins that his father did before him, and his heart was not wholly true to the Lord his God, as the heart of David his father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, for David's sake the Lord his God gave him a lamp in Jerusalem, setting up his son after him, and establishing Jerusalem,
speaker: Narrator

text: because David did what was right in the eyes of the Lord and did not turn aside from anything that he commanded him all the days of his life, except in the matter of Uriah the Hittite.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all the days of his life.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rest of the acts of Abijam and all that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah? And there was war between Abijam and Jeroboam.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Abijam slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David. And Asa his son reigned in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the twentieth year of Jeroboam king of Israel, Asa began to reign over Judah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he reigned for forty-one years in Jerusalem. His mother's name was Maacah the daughter of Abishalom.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Asa did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, as David his father had done.
speaker: Narrator

text: He put away the male cult prostitutes out of the land and removed all the idols that his fathers had made.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also removed Maacah his mother from being queen mother because she had made an abominable image for Asherah. And Asa cut down her image and burned it at the brook Kidron.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Baasha king of Israel went up against Judah and built Ramah, that he might permit no one to go out or come in to Asa king of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Asa took all the silver and the gold that were left in the treasures of the house of the Lord and the treasures of the king's house and gave them into the hands of his servants. And King Asa sent them to Ben-hadad the son of Tabrimmon, the son of Hezion, king of Syria, who lived in Damascus, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Let there be a covenant between me and you, as there was between my father and your father. Behold, I am sending to you a present of silver and gold. Go, break your covenant with Baasha king of Israel, that he may withdraw from me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ben-hadad listened to King Asa and sent the commanders of his armies against the cities of Israel and conquered Ijon, Dan, Abel-beth-maacah, and all Chinneroth, with all the land of Naphtali.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Baasha heard of it, he stopped building Ramah, and he lived in Tirzah.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

text: Now the rest of all the acts of Asa, all his might, and all that he did, and the cities that he built, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Judah? But in his old age he was diseased in his feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Asa slept with his fathers and was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father, and Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nadab the son of Jeroboam began to reign over Israel in the second year of Asa king of Judah, and he reigned over Israel for two years.
speaker: Narrator

text: He did what was evil in the sight of the Lord and walked in the way of his father, and in his sin which he made Israel to sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Baasha the son of Ahijah, of the house of Issachar, conspired against him. And Baasha struck him down at Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines, for Nadab and all Israel were laying siege to Gibbethon.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Baasha killed him in the third year of Asa king of Judah and reigned in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as soon as he was king, he killed all the house of Jeroboam. He left to the house of Jeroboam not one that breathed, until he had destroyed it, according to the word of the Lord that he spoke by his servant Ahijah the Shilonite.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was for the sins of Jeroboam that he sinned and that he made Israel to sin, and because of the anger to which he provoked the Lord, the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the rest of the acts of Nadab and all that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was war between Asa and Baasha king of Israel all their days.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the third year of Asa king of Judah, Baasha the son of Ahijah began to reign over all Israel at Tirzah, and he reigned for twenty-four years.
speaker: Narrator

text: He did what was evil in the sight of the Lord and walked in the way of Jeroboam and in his sin which he made Israel to sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the Lord came to Jehu the son of Hanani against Baasha, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Since I exalted you out of the dust and made you leader over my people Israel, and you have walked in the way of Jeroboam and have made my people Israel to sin, provoking me to anger with their sins,
speaker: Narrator

text: behold, I will utterly sweep away Baasha and his house, and I will make your house like the house of Jeroboam the son of Nebat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Anyone belonging to Baasha who dies in the city the dogs shall eat, and anyone of his who dies in the field the birds of the heavens shall eat.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the rest of the acts of Baasha and what he did, and his might, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Baasha slept with his fathers and was buried at Tirzah, and Elah his son reigned in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, the word of the Lord came by the prophet Jehu the son of Hanani against Baasha and his house, both because of all the evil that he did in the sight of the Lord, provoking him to anger with the work of his hands, in being like the house of Jeroboam, and also because he destroyed it.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the twenty-sixth year of Asa king of Judah, Elah the son of Baasha began to reign over Israel in Tirzah, and he reigned for two years.
speaker: Narrator

text: But his servant Zimri, commander of half his chariots, conspired against him. When he was at Tirzah, drinking himself drunk in the house of Arza, who was over the household in Tirzah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zimri came in and struck him down and killed him, in the twenty-seventh year of Asa king of Judah, and reigned in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he began to reign, as soon as he had seated himself on his throne, he struck down all the house of Baasha. He did not leave him a single male of his relatives or his friends.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus Zimri destroyed all the house of Baasha, according to the word of the Lord, which he spoke against Baasha by Jehu the prophet,
speaker: Narrator

text: for all the sins of Baasha and the sins of Elah his son, that they sinned and that they made Israel to sin, provoking the Lord God of Israel to anger with their idols.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the rest of the acts of Elah and all that he did, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
speaker: Narrator

text: In the twenty-seventh year of Asa king of Judah, Zimri reigned for seven days in Tirzah. Now the troops were encamped against Gibbethon, which belonged to the Philistines,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the troops who were encamped heard it said, “Zimri has conspired, and he has killed the king.” Therefore all Israel made Omri, the commander of the army, king over Israel that day in the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Omri went up from Gibbethon, and all Israel with him, and they besieged Tirzah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Zimri saw that the city was taken, he went into the citadel of the king's house and burned the king's house over him with fire and died,
speaker: Narrator

text: because of his sins that he committed, doing evil in the sight of the Lord, walking in the way of Jeroboam, and for his sin that he committed, making Israel to sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the rest of the acts of Zimri, and the conspiracy that he made, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the people of Israel were divided into two parts. Half of the people followed Tibni the son of Ginath, to make him king, and half followed Omri.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the people who followed Omri overcame the people who followed Tibni the son of Ginath. So Tibni died, and Omri became king.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the thirty-first year of Asa king of Judah, Omri began to reign over Israel, and he reigned for twelve years; for six years he reigned in Tirzah.
speaker: Narrator

text: He bought the hill of Samaria from Shemer for two talents of silver, and he fortified the hill and called the name of the city that he built Samaria, after the name of Shemer, the owner of the hill.
speaker: Narrator

text: Omri did what was evil in the sight of the Lord, and did more evil than all who were before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he walked in all the way of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, and in the sins that he made Israel to sin, provoking the Lord, the God of Israel, to anger by their idols.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the rest of the acts of Omri that he did, and the might that he showed, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the Kings of Israel?
speaker: Narrator

text: And Omri slept with his fathers and was buried in Samaria, and Ahab his son reigned in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the thirty-eighth year of Asa king of Judah, Ahab the son of Omri began to reign over Israel, and Ahab the son of Omri reigned over Israel in Samaria for twenty-two years.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ahab the son of Omri did evil in the sight of the Lord, more than all who were before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as if it had been a light thing for him to walk in the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, he took for his wife Jezebel the daughter of Ethbaal king of the Sidonians, and went and served Baal and worshipped him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He erected an altar for Baal in the house of Baal, which he built in Samaria.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ahab made an Asherah. Ahab did more to provoke the Lord, the God of Israel, to anger than all the kings of Israel who were before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: In his days Hiel of Bethel built Jericho. He laid its foundation at the cost of Abiram his firstborn, and set up its gates at the cost of his youngest son Segub, according to the word of the Lord, which he spoke by Joshua the son of Nun.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Elijah the Tishbite, of Tishbe in Gilead, said to Ahab, “As the Lord, the God of Israel, lives, before whom I stand, there shall be neither dew nor rain these years, except by my word.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the word of the Lord came to him:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Depart from here and turn eastwards and hide yourself by the brook Cherith, which is east of the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall drink from the brook, and I have commanded the ravens to feed you there.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So he went and did according to the word of the Lord. He went and lived by the brook Cherith that is east of the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the ravens brought him bread and meat in the morning, and bread and meat in the evening, and he drank from the brook.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after a while the brook dried up, because there was no rain in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the word of the Lord came to him,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Arise, go to Zarephath, which belongs to Sidon, and dwell there. Behold, I have commanded a widow there to feed you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So he arose and went to Zarephath. And when he came to the gate of the city, behold, a widow was there gathering sticks. And he called to her and said, “Bring me a little water in a vessel, that I may drink.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And as she was going to bring it, he called to her and said, “Bring me a morsel of bread in your hand.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And she said, “As the Lord your God lives, I have nothing baked, only a handful of flour in a jar and a little oil in a jug. And now I am gathering a couple of sticks that I may go in and prepare it for myself and my son, that we may eat it and die.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Elijah said to her, “Do not fear; go and do as you have said. But first make me a little cake of it and bring it to me, and afterwards make something for yourself and your son.
speaker: Narrator

text: For thus says the Lord, the God of Israel, ‘The jar of flour shall not be spent, and the jug of oil shall not be empty, until the day that the Lord sends rain upon the earth.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And she went and did as Elijah said. And she and he and her household ate for many days.
speaker: Narrator

text: The jar of flour was not spent, neither did the jug of oil become empty, according to the word of the Lord that he spoke by Elijah.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this the son of the woman, the mistress of the house, became ill. And his illness was so severe that there was no breath left in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she said to Elijah, “What have you against me, O man of God? You have come to me to bring my sin to remembrance and to cause the death of my son!”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to her, “Give me your son.” And he took him from her arms and carried him up into the upper chamber where he lodged, and laid him on his own bed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he cried to the Lord, “O Lord my God, have you brought calamity even upon the widow with whom I sojourn, by killing her son?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he stretched himself upon the child three times and cried to the Lord, “O Lord my God, let this child's life come into him again.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord listened to the voice of Elijah. And the life of the child came into him again, and he revived.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Elijah took the child and brought him down from the upper chamber into the house and delivered him to his mother. And Elijah said, “See, your son lives.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the woman said to Elijah, “Now I know that you are a man of God, and that the word of the Lord in your mouth is truth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After many days the word of the Lord came to Elijah, in the third year, saying, “Go, show yourself to Ahab, and I will send rain upon the earth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Elijah went to show himself to Ahab. Now the famine was severe in Samaria.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ahab called Obadiah, who was over the household. (Now Obadiah feared the Lord greatly,
speaker: Narrator

text: and when Jezebel cut off the prophets of the Lord, Obadiah took a hundred prophets and hid them by fifties in a cave and fed them with bread and water.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ahab said to Obadiah, “Go through the land to all the springs of water and to all the valleys. Perhaps we may find grass and save the horses and mules alive, and not lose some of the animals.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they divided the land between them to pass through it. Ahab went in one direction by himself, and Obadiah went in another direction by himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as Obadiah was on the way, behold, Elijah met him. And Obadiah recognized him and fell on his face and said, “Is it you, my lord Elijah?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he answered him, “It is I. Go, tell your lord, ‘Behold, Elijah is here.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “How have I sinned, that you would give your servant into the hand of Ahab, to kill me?
speaker: Narrator

text: As the Lord your God lives, there is no nation or kingdom where my lord has not sent to seek you. And when they would say, ‘He is not here’, he would take an oath of the kingdom or nation, that they had not found you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now you say, ‘Go, tell your lord, “Behold, Elijah is here.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: And as soon as I have gone from you, the Spirit of the Lord will carry you I know not where. And so, when I come and tell Ahab and he cannot find you, he will kill me, although I your servant have feared the Lord from my youth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Has it not been told my lord what I did when Jezebel killed the prophets of the Lord, how I hid a hundred men of the Lord's prophets by fifties in a cave and fed them with bread and water?
speaker: Narrator

text: And now you say, ‘Go, tell your lord, “Behold, Elijah is here”’; and he will kill me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Elijah said, “As the Lord of hosts lives, before whom I stand, I will surely show myself to him today.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Obadiah went to meet Ahab, and told him. And Ahab went to meet Elijah.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Ahab saw Elijah, Ahab said to him, “Is it you, you troubler of Israel?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he answered, “I have not troubled Israel, but you have, and your father's house, because you have abandoned the commandments of the Lord and followed the Baals.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore send and gather all Israel to me at Mount Carmel, and the 450 prophets of Baal and the 400 prophets of Asherah, who eat at Jezebel's table.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Ahab sent to all the people of Israel and gathered the prophets together at Mount Carmel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Elijah came near to all the people and said, “How long will you go limping between two different opinions? If the Lord is God, follow him; but if Baal, then follow him.” And the people did not answer him a word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Elijah said to the people, “I, even I only, am left a prophet of the Lord, but Baal's prophets are 450 men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let two bulls be given to us, and let them choose one bull for themselves and cut it in pieces and lay it on the wood, but put no fire to it. And I will prepare the other bull and lay it on the wood and put no fire to it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you call upon the name of your god, and I will call upon the name of the Lord, and the God who answers by fire, he is God.” And all the people answered, “It is well spoken.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Elijah said to the prophets of Baal, “Choose for yourselves one bull and prepare it first, for you are many, and call upon the name of your god, but put no fire to it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took the bull that was given them, and they prepared it and called upon the name of Baal from morning until noon, saying, “O Baal, answer us!” But there was no voice, and no one answered. And they limped round the altar that they had made.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at noon Elijah mocked them, saying, “Cry aloud, for he is a god. Either he is musing, or he is relieving himself, or he is on a journey, or perhaps he is asleep and must be awakened.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they cried aloud and cut themselves after their custom with swords and lances, until the blood gushed out upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as midday passed, they raved on until the time of the offering of the oblation, but there was no voice. No one answered; no one paid attention.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Elijah said to all the people, “Come near to me.” And all the people came near to him. And he repaired the altar of the Lord that had been thrown down.
speaker: Narrator

text: Elijah took twelve stones, according to the number of the tribes of the sons of Jacob, to whom the word of the Lord came, saying, “Israel shall be your name”,
speaker: Narrator

text: and with the stones he built an altar in the name of the Lord. And he made a trench about the altar, as great as would contain two seahs of seed.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he put the wood in order and cut the bull in pieces and laid it on the wood. And he said, “Fill four jars with water and pour it on the burnt offering and on the wood.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “Do it a second time.” And they did it a second time. And he said, “Do it a third time.” And they did it a third time.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the water ran round the altar and filled the trench also with water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at the time of the offering of the oblation, Elijah the prophet came near and said, “O Lord, God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, let it be known this day that you are God in Israel, and that I am your servant, and that I have done all these things at your word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Answer me, O Lord, answer me, that this people may know that you, O Lord, are God, and that you have turned their hearts back.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the fire of the Lord fell and consumed the burnt offering and the wood and the stones and the dust, and licked up the water that was in the trench.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when all the people saw it, they fell on their faces and said, “The Lord, he is God; the Lord, he is God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Elijah said to them, “Seize the prophets of Baal; let not one of them escape.” And they seized them. And Elijah brought them down to the brook Kishon and slaughtered them there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Elijah said to Ahab, “Go up, eat and drink, for there is a sound of the rushing of rain.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Ahab went up to eat and to drink. And Elijah went up to the top of Mount Carmel. And he bowed himself down on the earth and put his face between his knees.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to his servant, “Go up now, look towards the sea.” And he went up and looked and said, “There is nothing.” And he said, “Go again,” seven times.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at the seventh time he said, “Behold, a little cloud like a man's hand is rising from the sea.” And he said, “Go up, say to Ahab, ‘Prepare your chariot and go down, lest the rain stop you.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And in a little while the heavens grew black with clouds and wind, and there was a great rain. And Ahab rode and went to Jezreel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the hand of the Lord was on Elijah, and he gathered up his garment and ran before Ahab to the entrance of Jezreel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahab told Jezebel all that Elijah had done, and how he had killed all the prophets with the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jezebel sent a messenger to Elijah, saying, “So may the gods do to me and more also, if I do not make your life as the life of one of them by this time tomorrow.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he was afraid, and he arose and ran for his life and came to Beersheba, which belongs to Judah, and left his servant there.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he himself went a day's journey into the wilderness and came and sat down under a broom tree. And he asked that he might die, saying, “It is enough; now, O Lord, take away my life, for I am no better than my fathers.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he lay down and slept under a broom tree. And behold, an angel touched him and said to him, “Arise and eat.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he looked, and behold, there was at his head a cake baked on hot stones and a jar of water. And he ate and drank and lay down again.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the angel of the Lord came again a second time and touched him and said, “Arise and eat, for the journey is too great for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he arose and ate and drank, and went in the strength of that food forty days and forty nights to Horeb, the mount of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: There he came to a cave and lodged in it. And behold, the word of the Lord came to him, and he said to him, “What are you doing here, Elijah?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “I have been very jealous for the Lord, the God of hosts. For the people of Israel have forsaken your covenant, thrown down your altars, and killed your prophets with the sword, and I, even I only, am left, and they seek my life, to take it away.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “Go out and stand on the mount before the Lord.” And behold, the Lord passed by, and a great and strong wind tore the mountains and broke in pieces the rocks before the Lord, but the Lord was not in the wind. speaker: Narrator

text: And after the earthquake a fire, but the Lord was not in the fire. And after the fire the sound of a low whisper.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Elijah heard it, he wrapped his face in his cloak and went out and stood at the entrance of the cave. And behold, there came a voice to him and said, “What are you doing here, Elijah?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “I have been very jealous for the Lord, the God of hosts. For the people of Israel have forsaken your covenant, thrown down your altars, and killed your prophets with the sword, and I, even I only, am left, and they seek my life, to take it away.”

speaker: Narrator

text: “Have you seen how Ahab has humbled himself before me? Because he has humbled himself before me, I will not bring the disaster in his days; but in his son's days I will bring the disaster upon his house.”

text: For three years Syria and Israel continued without war.
speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator

speaker: Narrator
